As a result, Zemskov received a mine explosion injury with severe injuries, and Ivashchenko received fractures and hematomas. -This explosion stunned him [Ivashchenko], and he experienced a state of shock, the doors of the BMP-1 opened from the blast wave, he fell on his back from the landing compartment to the ground, after which he began to shout -really the 300th,- pointing his finger inside the landing compartment of the BMP-1, since he realized that [Zemskov] had suffered bodily harm,- the verdict says. Vonotkov admitted guilt, but refused to comment.In 2020, a junior sergeant died at the same training ground, receiving a through wound to the chest. Then the court imposed a two-year suspended sentence on the leader of the shooting.

Title: üñº A resident of Cherepovets was denied an abortion in all medica...
Description: A resident of Cherepovets was denied an abortion in all medical institutions in the city A 38-year-old resident of Cherepovets, Natalya (name changed), was denied an abortion in antenatal clinics in the city, as well as in private clinics in Cherepovets and Vologda. According to the woman, medical institutions in the region actually stopped providing this service without official explanation. -I live in the Cherepovets region, I have three children, my youngest daughter is three years old. I planned to go to work, but found out I was pregnant. I contacted a doctor at my place of residence, but I was told that he was not responsible for performing abortions. In a private clinic they did an ultrasound, set the period at eight weeks and explained that medical termination of pregnancy at this stage is no longer possible,- Natalya told the Rech newspaper. After this, the woman tried to sign up for an operation at the city maternity hospital, but was refused. -Yesterday was the last day we performed abortions. From today we have no right,- they told her over the phone.She received a similar answer in other antenatal clinics in the city. During a personal visit to one of the consultations, Natalia was explained that at the regional level a decision had been made to recommend that all women under 50 years of age continue pregnancy. However, she was not provided with any official documents, and she was not given a written refusal to have an abortion. Later, the woman turned to the official community of the maternity hospital on the social network VKontakte with a request to explain the reasons for the refusal. In response, she was informed that -termination of pregnancy is carried out only for medical reasons in a 24-hour hospital- and that this issue is regulated at the level of the government of the Vologda region. The couple considered the possibility of leaving the child, but came to the conclusion that they would not be able to provide for him morally and financially. -My husband already works three jobs. I spent ten years on maternity leave, and now I wanted to return to my professional activities,- explained Natalya. As a result, the woman had to go to a private clinic in the Yaroslavl region, where they agreed to carry out the operation without restrictions. The cost of the procedure was about nine thousand rubles.

He emphasized that the party will not allow history to be rewritten and evaded responsibility.In recent years, monuments to Stalin have been erected regularly in Russia. These include busts and full-length monuments. In November-December 2024 alone, three monuments to Stalin were erected - in the Primorsky Territory, in North Ossetia and in the Vologda region. Description: -When asked to stop and screams of pain, Kurbanov only laughed.- In a military unit in the Khabarovsk Territory, a soldier from Dagestan broke the leg of a conscript. In response to requests to stop and cries of pain, Kurbanov only laughed and continued to put pressure on his leg. Title: üñº An official from Komi, accused of corruption, asks to go to wa...
Description: An official from Komi, accused of corruption, asks to go to war with UkraineFormer first deputy head of the administration of the city of Pechora in the Komi Republic, Andrei Kanishchev, who is under investigation on charges of corruption, signed a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense and expressed his intention to go to the zone of a special military operation in Ukraine. A corresponding petition to suspend the criminal case was received by the Pechora City Court, but at the moment it has not yet been considered, local media writes.  Kanishchev is accused of receiving a bribe on an especially large scale and exceeding official authority. According to investigators, he, together with the former mayor of Pechora Valery Serov, received a bribe in the amount of four million rubles from a commercial company for assistance in concluding a government contract to carry out work to improve the city. At the time of the initiation of this criminal case, Kanishchev was already in custody on another charge. In February 2024, he was sentenced to 10 years in prison for intentionally causing grievous bodily harm, negligently resulting in the death of the victim. In August 2022, Kanishchev hit sound engineer Viktor Fateev during a fire show on the main stage of Pechora, which led to his death. The case of Kanishchev is notsingle. Since the beginning of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, 108 Russian officials and deputies have declared their desire to go to the front. Of these, 70 did this voluntarily, and 18, who were under criminal prosecution, chose to avoid it by signing contracts with the Ministry of Defense. The remaining 20 people subsequently abandoned their intentions.In March 2023, the mayor of Vorkuta, Yaroslav Shaposhnikov, announced that he would go to war in Ukraine. But he did this only after 118 days, citing the fact that the then acting head of Komi, Vladimir Uyba, asked him to stay.In May 2023, the acting Minister of Health of Komi, Igor Diaghilev, voluntarily went to the front, where he worked as a traumatologist in a military hospital. A year and a half later, in October 2024, after his return, he was appointed deputy prime minister of the government of the republic.The former first deputy head of the administration of Syktyvkar, Alexander Mozhegov, also found himself in the combat zone. The reasons for his participation in the war were not officially reported.Another official from Komi, ex-head of the Kortkeros district Alexander Arteev, came to the front from a penal colony. In 2023, he was sentenced to 13 years in prison for accepting bribes. In July 2024, his death became known.

The lawyers appealed the verdict, but on February 12, Judge Stanislav Makarov left it unchanged, write -Free News-.At the trial Kiryukhin admitted guilt, explaining that he committed the attack while intoxicated and -out of hooligan motives.- He also expressed a desire, after the verdict, to sign a new contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense and go to the front again.Kiryukhin's neighbors filed civil claims against him for compensation for moral damage in the amount of five million rubles. Description: The -Doomsday Radio Station- broadcast 25 messagesThe Russian radio station UVB-76, known among radio amateurs as the -Doomsday Radio Station- or -Buzzer,- broadcast 25 messages. The last message was recorded at 17:15. Before February 24, 2022, UVB-76 also transmitted strange messages.UVB-76 began broadcasting in the late 1970s and has since attracted the attention of radio amateurs and researchers. Most of the time the station broadcasts monotonous sounds, for which it received the nickname -Buzzer-. From time to time, words or phrases appear on the air, the purpose of which remains the subject of debate and speculation. Possibilities include using the station to transmit coded military messages or to calibrate radar systems.By versions The station's radio tower is connected to the Russian Perimeter missile system and emits a so-called -Dead Hand- signal that will trigger a nuclear retaliatory strike if the signal is interrupted by a nuclear attack against Russia.At the end 2024 Chairman of the State Duma Committee of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation on Defense Andrey Kartapolov statedthat UVB-76 is not related to the Perimeter system, while emphasizing that -this radio station really has its own function and its own quite important task-
